intro: Microstaphyla columbiana, commonly known as the Columbian microstaphyla, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. The plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded, forested environments. It has small, leathery leaves and produces pink to white blooms in the spring. Due to its limited habitat and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
